intro: Dracocephalum nervosum, commonly known as narrow-leaf blueweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically blue to purple in color, arranged in dense spikes, and bloom during the summer months. Dracocephalum nervosum is often found in dry grasslands and rocky soils, and it has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
